etymologies: mid 19th century: from modern Latin pyrophorus, from Greek purophoros ‘fire-bearing’, from pur ‘fire’ + pherein ‘to bear’

definitions: liable to ignite spontaneously on exposure to air

examples.text: several boranes are pyrophoric and toxic

shortDefinitions: liable to ignite spontaneously on exposure to air

definitions: (of an alloy) emitting sparks when scratched or struck.
shortDefinitions: emitting sparks when scratched or struck
